diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute calculus cholecystitis, Cholangitis, E coli bacteremia
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with symptoms consistent with cholangitis, including nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, and fever. Laboratory findings showed elevated white blood cell count and liver enzymes, further supporting the diagnosis. Imaging indicated mild gallbladder wall thickening and pericholecystic fat stranding, consistent with acute cholecystitis.
